snippet: The government’s gains have sent insurgents scrambling, led civilians to flee toward the border with Turkey and scuttled peace talks in Geneva.
abstract: Forces of Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad press advantage in northern province of Aleppo, causing insurgent groups to flee and thousands of civilians to make their way to border with Turkey; advance of Syrian forces has undermined planned peace talks that were to be mediated by United Nations.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Maher Samaan from Paris; Ceylan Yeginsu from Izmir, Turkey; Somini Sengupta from the United Nations and Gardiner Harris from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The government’s gains have sent insurgents scrambling, led civilians to flee toward the border with Turkey and scuttled peace talks in Geneva.

headline.main: Syrian Forces Press Aleppo, Sending Thousands Fleeing
headline.print_headline: Assad Forces Gain Momentum Around Aleppo

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
